website_summaries.verdict: Transporter is a NAS that wants to be a cloud storage service. It offers a simple way to share data across multiple sites and users in secure and private way.
pros: Easy to sync and backup data
Can access remote Transporters over Web
cons: Need to know other users' email addresses

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This was my second Transporter. Works great under El Capitan. Does not work under Sierra. The company that owns Transporter (Nexsan) has End of Life date as of September 1, 2016. Sorry I bought it. Looks like the complete Transporter line is being discontinued. I guess I'll take the drives out and use them for miscellaneous storage.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Mcclaskey

customer_reviews.title: Once you understand how best to use them they work great
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these things at work, spread out over 3 different buildings, and one is a backup just in case. Once you understand how best to use them they work great. I do wish they would have made them support 3.5" HDD's internally or make made them compatible with multiple disc external hard drive systems. The weak link is always the upload speed (Mediacom). I do wish you could access documents on cell phone and tablets without having to download them to the device first, or if they would automatically upload the new copy with it's changes. still a lot of room for improvement but they do what they said the would.
customer_reviews.author: One persons opinion

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised and well for me
customer_reviews.text: I have been collecting videos and pictures for a long time. Some videos I recorded back with my big Beta camera. That was a long time ago. I now have them in digital form and wanted to share them with the rest of the family. We just went to Mexico to visit them and it was a huge hit to show my nephews and their wives and families the videos and pictures of when they were little. Another reason why I bought this is that I wanted to have a second and independent place where I backup all of these data. This is working very well.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Garcia-Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Having my own cloud was easier than I thought
customer_reviews.text: The Transporter is a great product and set-up was as simple as drag-and-drop the files. My only complaint is the load-up time of the files is slow when compared to either Google Drive or Dropbox. I do not mirror my files on my computers; they only reside on the Transporter drive; so this is probably a huge part of the "slowness." That said, you cannot beat the price/GB when compared to either Google or Dropbox. My cable modem network speed is 100 Mbps/20Mbs.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K

customer_reviews.title: Great for persons worried about HIPPA requirements.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine. It does exactly what I wanted it to do, which is keep my documents on my disc drive, but is accessible from various other locations. As I have to be concerned about HIPPA laws, this is a great way to deal with that and being in control of your documents and location of them.
customer_reviews.author: Joel J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Unclear Information
customer_reviews.text: My 2 TB Transporter did NOT come with a drive. The technical details correctly indicate the drive size as 0. However, some people in the reviews and answers to questions section seem to believe that the 2 TB unit comes with a drive. Mine did not. If I could post this without indicating a rating I would (I still have not used it - waiting for the delivery of the drive).
customer_reviews.author: Moose C.

customer_reviews.title: Slow and Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's slow but it has worked for my needs for the past year. *Update* Back from a holiday and turned it on. It's now in a perpetual reboot and is completely unusable. All files stored in the Transporter Library are gone. Nexsan/Drobo customer support doesn't respond to support tickets.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Safe and mine
customer_reviews.text: I use my transporter in the same way I use Dropbox. I didn't want to have a service for this, I prefer a one time purchase. I also like the Library feature, this allows me to not have all the data from the transporter in my computer. I recently moved to Germany and it was really comforting that all my data was backed up and stored and accesible in different places. I decided to take the transporter with me, but just as easily I could have left it back home. Also, setting it up and re-setting it up has been really easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Guardia

customer_reviews.title: Customer service from company is awful to non-existent.
customer_reviews.text: Support for these devices are almost non-existent. If it works well, it works great. If it works poorly, you will never get the support people to listen to you or help fix it. I've bought two and I won't buy these anymore.
customer_reviews.author: N. Pomeroy

customer_reviews.title: WOWZER!
customer_reviews.text: I initially heard about the Transporter from a friend who bought one on Kickstarter. I was really intrigued by the idea of what the Transporter could do. I bought one and can honestly tell you that the instructions were easy to follow, and after a few minutes, I had my own personal, private cloud. Now, I'm able to share files, photos and documents with family and friends, because accessing and sharing the folders and files from anywhere WITHOUT monthly cloud fees does, in a word: ROCK!
customer_reviews.author: Ridgeback Dad

customer_reviews.title: As advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. We are using it to manage raw image files with remote employees. Really fixed our Dropbox bottle-neck. Speedy and reliable. I set it up and haven't had to think about it since, perfect. iOS app is nothing to brag about though.
customer_reviews.author: Yelmorb

customer_reviews.title: Loved this so much I bought a second
customer_reviews.text: I love having this device. I had a spare hard drive that I could fit in the device. I loved it so much I bought a second one that allowed my to connect any size hard drive via USB to the device
customer_reviews.author: Thomas O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I'm so impressed by the effort that went into this product. I now have 1,000 gigs to use at my disposal & I can select specific folders not to sync with my computer that would otherwise take up room. Thus I can now share photos and large movie files so much easier with my wife than the quirky methods I had to use before. And I can sync this Transporter with another?! Wow. Now, if I could just get all the people who share Dropbox folders with me to switch over to sharing Transporter folders.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Does what the advertising and descriptions claim. Set-up can be challenging if there is a need to "port-map" a router to gain connection from the Internet but the instructions are pretty clear. Now that the iOS application is available it really is a viable replacement for cloud storage solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen I. Levine

customer_reviews.title: Transporter
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical. I was wrong. It works! I don't even think about what it's doing now. Well done hardware & software.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN S R DEACON

customer_reviews.title: Simple to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were easy to follow. It took about 20 minutes for it to format and to get recognized by the software. Accessing and sharing the Folders and files from anywhere on private storage without the cloud monthly fees is great.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Lee

customer_reviews.title: will buy another one soon...
customer_reviews.text: Purchasing a diskless transporter and then getting a WD20NPVX 2TB drive turned out to be a much cheaper option for me. The device works as expected and I managed to setup everything easily.
customer_reviews.author: P. Salgado

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: Backs up my entire hard drive and lets me access everything from my cell phone. It exceeds the expectations I have prior to the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Love my transporter
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, it has not an internal hard drive but if you install it will work just perfect
customer_reviews.author: John Colon

customer_reviews.title: Works like it says
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical, but after getting it setup (very easy BTW), it works just as it should. I went out out town & tested it & it worked just as it should. I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Walston

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great personal cloud storage, I love having control over my personal content and not having to shell out monthly or yearly fees for cloud service. It was easy to setup and and share documents and content with others. I would highly recommend this product to anyone in the market for personal cloud storage. I will actually be buying another one later in the year and sending it to a friend to have a back up of my content in another location/State.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Edwards

customer_reviews.title: I had a very similar experience to many of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a very similar experience to many of the "1 star" reviewers. The company rarely responds and despite promises of refunding money - the don't. You but at your own risk and if it doesn't work don't count on help.
customer_reviews.author: CPE

customer_reviews.title: very very slow. .. not your own personne drop box.
customer_reviews.text: Very slow compared to drop box. This will not replace Dropbox , I guess I thought it would . Whatever you need has to be downloaded Wich could take eternity and then you have to delete it again since the point is to not take up space by leaving on the drop box. Therefore every time you need the file or picture you need to go through the long download process. Definitely not perfected .. good idea but not there yet.
customer_reviews.author: bob silver

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It works like a dream! 2TB of online storage and no monthly fees. Just plug it in and synch up and forget!
customer_reviews.author: Nivek

customer_reviews.title: A Good Storage/Access Device
customer_reviews.text: It works well as a remote-access NAS. However, often sends messages about 'appearing' to be offline when it is not. Power failures will sometimes require a complete new setup procedure to be performed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: If you want to have access to your files wherever you are, this is the product for you. As long as you have an internet connection you can get to them.
customer_reviews.author: Gramibear

customer_reviews.title: Good product for private data storage and syncing
customer_reviews.text: Good product for private data storage and syncing. Had a few quirks with the software when using shared folders and selective sync but eventually got it all working well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Fonti

customer_reviews.title: Too unstable at this point.
customer_reviews.text: Particularly if you have more than one person accessing files at the same time. Files get corrupted, disappear. Great concept, but needs more tweaking to be worth the hassle for a small business.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon consumer

customer_reviews.title: Far behind dropbox
customer_reviews.text: No auto upload after taking photos. Can't be live streaming video or music. No thumbnail photo for preview. Sharing is annoying for unregistered friends.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kwok

customer_reviews.title: Sounds better than it is.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately not as good as it sounds. I am an IT professional but did not manage to set it up in a way that it was useful to me personally (we wanted it as a Dropbox for Photos or something like that). We also tried to use it at work, but same thing. Now it is up for sale :(
customer_reviews.author: Doktor M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Hard drive enclosed
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3 times, each time was shipped without the 1TB hard drive. Finally ordered from supplier. Works great with Hard drive enclosed, have already upgraded to higher capacity HDD
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Wallis

customer_reviews.title: New to Transporter
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. I'm still loading files but find accessing what I have loaded a breeze. Email tips are very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Harris

customer_reviews.title: good idea but need be completed
customer_reviews.text: Where is an Android app? And a desktop app for Win xp? If this is a private cloud we must to do acces it from the net.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Nalda

customer_reviews.title: It's really easy to setup and get it up and running within ...
customer_reviews.text: It's really easy to setup and get it up and running within minutes. Just too bad it only supports 2.5" laptop type hard disk and capacity is limited. It'll be great if it could support 5.25" standard harddisk, with much higher capacity availability.
customer_reviews.author: LIM KIM YONG

customer_reviews.title: Very Hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: This device is nothing like a Dropbox. It is not possible to send links to individual files, it is very difficult to sigh up to be able to use folder sharing, no web interface.
customer_reviews.author: jay cwener

customer_reviews.title: I just loaded the video & it works great but & haven't work on the project yet
customer_reviews.text: I just loaded the video & it works great but & haven't work on the project yet. I'm in video editing & in a few weeks I will know if the loaded video is receive outside the country
customer_reviews.author: Daisy V. Aseniero

customer_reviews.title: Getting There!
customer_reviews.text: Still getting acquainted with the device and getting it organize appropriately. It should work well. Once I get it organized to work for my intended purposes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Is not compatible with earlier versions of Mac OSX or Windows
customer_reviews.text: The Transporter software does not work with earlier versions of Mac OSX (Snow Leopard) or Windows (XP). This limits the number of potential people with whom I would've shared files. Otherwise, it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kawashima

customer_reviews.title: what if something goes wrong?
customer_reviews.text: Interesting concept but... I bought the one without HD and put in a spare HD. It did not work. I could not claim it on web and no diagnostic is available. Contacting the customer support does not help much as they cannot really understand what is going on. I like the simplicity of all this, but there must be a way to handle issues... at the end all your data may be in there. Plus, why it needs the HDD to boot up and to get online? this is a big limitation. I am sure it will get better but for now be careful, in particular with the version without HD.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano Fornari

customer_reviews.title: Can not get it to work.
customer_reviews.text: I got the device and hooked it up as described. But I can not figure how to get files from my computer to the device. After loading the software onto my computer the correct button for sending info to the transporter does not exist. When trying to get support one is pushed to another support service that does not support this device. Good idea, bad implementation!!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Not a new product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a new transporter, what I got was an opened used product. I knew it was opened because the security tape discs on the bottom of the box were full of hair and dust and had no adhesive properties left. Returned and reordered it happened a second time. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Chart case

customer_reviews.title: This is Not For Herbs
customer_reviews.text: Thought this thing was a vaporizer for potted plants and herbs
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Hinklein

product_meta.title: Nexsan Transporter Private Cloud - 1TB (CTR1D12US1R)
product_meta.description:
Capacity:1TB

Transporter is a private, peer-to-peer cloud storage device for sharing, accessing, and protecting unlimited amounts of files without using the cloud. As a device you own and control, it is completely private and there are no monthly fees or subscriptions. This version of Transporter comes with a 1 TB 2.5-inch SATA hard drive so you can start storing and sharing your files right away.

Access files stored on Transporter from any computer or mobile device with Internet access. View larger.Share large collections of files with your friends and family from one single, secure location.
View larger.Add terabytes of storage to your iPad and iPhone with Transporter's mobile app. View larger.SYNC FILES BETWEEN ALL YOUR DIGITAL DEVICES
A hassle-free alternative to cloud storage, Transporter makes it easy to keep your entire digital life synced and organized across all of your devices. Transporter lets you sync only those files you want to a particular device, making it ideal for syncing with limited-capacity mobile devices and smartphones. And for your larger capacity devices, such as your home computer, there is no more need to worry about capacity limits holding you back from enjoying and sharing your files whenever you want.

EASILY SHARE AN ENTIRE MOVIE COLLECTION WITH FAMILY AND FRIENDS
Transporter is ideal for sharing large collections of files, such as your entire photo or home movie collection with family and friends. You can share up to 2 Terabytes per Transporter, which is enough space for 2,000 HD movies, 400,000 songs, or 1,000,000 photos.

Since Transporter is a device you own and control, you will never have to worry about monthly fees or subscriptions to store and access your data. This makes Transporter an easy, cost-effective, and completely secure way to share your media collection with those around you.

PRIVATELY COLLABORATE WITH CO-WORKERS AND COLLEAGUES
Whether you're a lawyer, doctor, dentist, financial planner, or mortgage broker, the need to share, collaborate, access, and protect confidential files is a must. Transporter gives you full control of the location and redundancy of your data, whether you need to collaborate with colleagues in another office, or just need secure mobile access.

Because files stored on Transporter are only transferred between Transporter devices and authorized computers, your files are never stored in the cloud and remain completely private and secure at all times. Files transferred between Transporter devices are always encrypted during transit, so you can rest assured that personal documents are only being stored and viewed by people you have authorized.

ACCESS ALL YOUR FILES FROM ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD
If you're on the road for business and need access to the latest spreadsheets or simply want to download a movie while on vacation, Transporter lets you access your files remotely from anywhere in the world. All files stored on your Transporter, regardless of size or type, are accessible when using the free Windows, Mac, Android or iOS software on any supported device.

AUTOMATICALLY PROTECT VALUABLE FILES OFFSITE
Transporter offers the easiest way to protect your files offsite. A full copy of shared files is kept on each Transporter, and changes to any files are automatically synced in real-time between shared devices. This ensures everyone has the most recent copy of your files no matter where you are. Should access to your primary Transporter ever be interrupted, software will automatically continue to access files from any shared Transporter until your local network is restored.

ADD TERABYTES OF STORAGE TO YOUR IPAD AND IPHONE
Transporter removes the need to constantly shuffle movies around or delete photos to keep from running out of space on your mobile device. You can use Transporter to store everything that you don't have space for on your mobile device and download it when you need it. Using the free Transporter app, you can download a movie for a flight or show friends your favorite pictures of your kids.

DRIVE SPECIFICATIONS
The Transporter is a Serial ATA (SATA II) device, and works with most recently manufactured 2.5-inch SATA hard drives, commonly known as mobile, laptop, or notebook drives.

More specifically:

 * SATA II, SATA-300, SATA 3Gb/s (Rev 2.0 SATA)
 * SATA III, SATA-600, SATA 6Gb/s (Rev 3.0 SATA, backwards compatible)
 * Minimum disk capacity: 160GB
 * Drive thickness: 7mm, 9.5mm, 12.5mm, and 15mm

This makes Transporter one of the few consumer electronic devices that can physically accommodate 2TB 2.5-inch mobile hard drives.

OPERATING SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
 * Mac OS X 10.7.x Lion
 * Mac OS X 10.8.x Mountain Lion 
 * Windows 7 SP1 32 and 64 bit
 * Windows 8 32 and 64 bit
 * Apple iOS 5.1.x and higher
 * Android 4.0.x and higher

Please note: A direct connection to your router via Gigabit Ethernet is highly recommended for optimal performance.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Transporter, one 1TB 2.5-inch SATA HDD, power supply, drive carrier, Ethernet cable, and set up guide.

CONNECTED DATA TRANSPORTER WITH 1TB DRIVE
KEY FEATURES
 * Automatic real-time syncing between devices
 * 100% private with files never stored in the cloud
 * No subscriptions or monthly fees
 * Unlimited sharing with no restrictions on file size or type
 * Access from any computer or mobile device with Internet access
 * Comes with 1 TB SATA hard drive
